articles.description: Wimbledon champ Boris Becker has been found guilty at Southwark Crown Court of four charges under the Insolvency Act and acquitted of a further 20 counts relating to his 2017 bankruptcy.
articles.content:
Three-time Wimbledon champion Boris Becker is facing a prison sentence of up to seven years after today being found guilty of breaking UK insolvency laws.
The six-time Grand Slam champ, 54, was accu… [+15704 chars]

articles.author: Kishan Vaghela, Mark Duell
articles.title: British Cycling BAN trans cyclists from racing, while they re-work their policy - Daily Mail
articles.description: British Cycling has suspended its transgender and non-binary participation policy in the aftermath of Emily Bridges' failed attempt to enter a women's event at a UK championships event.
articles.content:
British Cycling today banned transgender riders from competing in national events and vowed to rework its policy which it admitted was 'unfair on all women cyclists'.
